question:
You are studying a short course in another country. Your accommodation was arranged by the course provider. There is a major problem with accommodation.
Write a letter to the course provider. In your letter:
•	say what the problem is
•	describe the accommodation you thought you were getting
•	ask the provider to solve the problem
text: I am writing this letter to show my dissatisfaction with the accommodation provided by you. The accommodation which has been allocated to me is too far from the university and I have to travel 3 hours in total per day. Apart from the traveling issue, there so much noise coming from the nearby society due to construction work going on day and night.

I was under the impression that I would be getting a nearby location from university so that I could walk and reach college in less duration of time. Probably, it would reduce my transportation cost and simultaneously decrease my travel time and I would be able to concentrate on my studies in a much better way.
I will be grateful to you if you can relocate me to any other accommodation which is much closer to the university having a noise-free environment.
Looking forward to hearing from you.

error_list.error_des: The spelling of traveling is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
It seems that you are missing a verb. Consider adding it.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
